question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

If not, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the President of the United States by the close of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday or will he cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if either (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if neither condition is met.

Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday, or will he no longer hold the position of President before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves YES if either (a) there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if neither of these scenarios occurs.

Note: A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday, or will he no longer hold the office of President before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if either (a) there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves to NO if neither condition occurs.

Note: A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, since Acting President is not the same as President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden die before Saturday, or might he cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if either (a) an official announcement of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden resigns, passes away, or otherwise ends his presidency before July 2024 concludes (ET). It will be NO if neither of these situations occurs.

Note: A temporary shift of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his VP as Acting President) does not result in a YES conclusion, as Acting President is not regarded as President according to the Constitution.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.body:

This resolves the same way as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt about Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 presidential election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You may contact @jskf to request an early resolution or report any issues.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original inquiry resolves, its result will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Please feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be resolved as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It exclusively addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place *after* the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has officially been barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

This barring is confirmed through official statements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for resolution.

The answer will be negative if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role under the mentioned criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Standings at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the United States Olympic Team is the (sole) highest positioned team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team attains a ranking that is higher or equal to that of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and arranging them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In cases of ties at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In cases of ties at 2) Total Bronze Medals.

1. Total Gold Medals

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prohibited from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prohibited from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: The inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the given criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face disqualification or obstruction from being listed on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" response if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be confirmed through official declarations from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for a resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will conclude negatively.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A significant number of House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the crucial ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and somehow force unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker participating in the initiative.

A letter in draft form, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, presents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are significantly concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart approach to shut down debate and somehow force unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will conclude YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by a minimum of 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters accumulate a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be adequate for this market to resolve as YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic lawmakers from either the House or Senate publicly support a letter against the plan to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Several Democrats in the House are working together to express their disapproval of their party's effort to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination, arguing that it stifles the essential ongoing dialogue about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A draft letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public signal from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are deeply worried about Biden's candidacy progressing.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it's a clever tactic to silence debate and somehow enforce unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm the letter's existence.

This market will conclude YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if several letters gather a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements, that would also suffice for this market to resolve as YES. 

If these criteria are not met by the market closing, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" in this context means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome remains positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was observed in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing for the submission of inquiries to systems based on Large Language Models).

The phrase "available to the general populace" in this context means that the typical scenario for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without the need for a VPN (although it may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in certain EU countries (as noted in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific demographics (like minors), it will still be deemed a favorable outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

In this scenario, "ChatGPT" pertains to the usual web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one letter would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will be marked YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party House Representatives or Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or it might occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Reports involving any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and urging him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In any unclear situations where such names are mentioned but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

This could happen through the signing of a letter or other methods, such as a collective meeting with Biden where they jointly ask him to step down. All five individuals must be part of the same communication. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not satisfy this condition unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before this market's closing date.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. The statement must be unambiguous and definitive, leaving no chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Will the crossover film featuring Deadpool and Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? [in comparison to Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The movie, directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide during its opening weekend. This would establish a new record for the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is projected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the highest R-rated opening in history.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new release surpass these figures? It is likely to be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a massive success at the time, and somewhat unexpected.

Since BoxOfficeMojo has a peculiar way of reporting international opening weekends -- it shows the raw figures but aggregates them oddly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to confirm what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words, the numbers from BoxOfficeMojo should be considered unofficial until there is a confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the target figure we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will either Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine or will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, including voice roles, even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

(b) "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The previous record is $284.5 million held by the original Deadpool.

The previous record stands at $284.5 million, held by the original Deadpool.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault credited to Israel, taking place within Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel has taken place within Iran, resulting in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if, following the date this question is posed and before May 1, 2024, credible information indicates that an attack associated with Israel has occurred in Iran, leading to the deaths of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

The answer to this question hinges solely on the nominee selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is officially recognized as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:

Conversely, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament representing any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome will be **No**.

The resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak stands as a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?

The resolution must reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is contesting in any constituency).

para_P.title: Could Rishi Sunak fail to win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:

On the other hand, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the election on July 4, 2024, the answer will be **No**.

The conclusion must be based on [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news outlets or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (if he is running in any constituency).

question.body:

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but no greater than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the graph for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates Trump is in the lead, while a negative number signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no greater than 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, if the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden exceed 2 but remain under 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the disparity in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, which will be analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number represents a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be understood as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt about Biden's willingness to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden publicly announce prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** answer if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear and public official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be unambiguous and definitive: it should remove any uncertainty regarding Biden's intention to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a definitive statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 in the 538 national polling average, or will Joe Biden declare prior to that date that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and does not go beyond 3, based on the chart reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that Biden will not run and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before that date that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) The national polling average from 538 shows that Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, as indicated in the chart viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

If neither of these criteria are fulfilled, the question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3 based on 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024, or will Joe Biden make a public announcement prior to that date stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a **Yes** response if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 but not exceeding 3, as shown in the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value signifies a lead for Trump.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official declaration that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive.

If neither of these conditions is met, the outcome will be recorded as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise no longer holds the office before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be confirmed with a YES if Biden is still serving as the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in his position as President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a YES if Biden continues to hold the office of US President at the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (According to the Constitution, the Acting President is not regarded as the President.)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It is strictly focused on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prohibited from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prohibited from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face disqualification or be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will yield a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump is officially disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be confirmed through official statements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news outlets. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for a conclusion.

The question will result in a "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account legal challenges, appeals, or any subsequent developments occurring after the specified date. It strictly examines whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 or Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to continue as President until the end of July 2024, or for Trump to be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as "Yes" if any of the following happens:

(a) Biden stays in office as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This will be marked as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (for instance, appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is considered distinct from the President under the Constitution.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will resolve as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome, as the Acting President is distinct from the President under the Constitution.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the mentioned criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that he is not disqualified from any ballot by July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

This will be recorded as "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not count as a "Yes" outcome, since the Acting President is considered separate from the President according to the Constitution.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prohibition must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative writings, opinion articles, or unofficial comments will not suffice for resolution. The question will be marked as "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024. Note: This inquiry does not account for legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely examines whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and later reinstated, such that he is not disqualified from any ballot by July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five specific Democratic House Representatives or Senators persuade Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would urge Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the matter.

This market will resolve to YES if a group of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as signing a letter like the one mentioned above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden and collectively asking him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same coordinated message. If five individuals independently express to the media their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not count as a YES.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.body:

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more hectic. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will be deemed YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be executed by endorsing a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or it could take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals independently expressing their opinion to the media that Biden should withdraw does not fulfill the criteria for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these stipulations are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 5 recognized Democratic House Representatives or US Senators urge Biden to step down before July 20th?
para_P.body:
As reported by Politico:

Two representatives from secure districts have already made public statements calling for Biden to withdraw. Furthermore, two of the most at-risk Democrats have indicated to local news outlets that they think Biden's likelihood of winning in November is low.

Behind the scenes, the dynamics are even more intense. Multiple drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, and at least one version would encourage Biden to end his campaign, according to five sources familiar with the matter.

This market will be considered YES if a coalition of no fewer than five recognized Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to request Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election bid, or to motivate him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be accomplished by endorsing a letter akin to the one mentioned above, or it could manifest in another way, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to jointly ask him to withdraw.

This market specifies that all five individuals must convey the same collective message. Five individuals independently stating to the media that Biden should resign does not meet the criteria for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and asking him to step down will not satisfy the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly revealed before the market's closure. In instances where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will tend towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not met before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
