question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, regarding his refusal to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the declaration must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt about Biden's intention to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, and official statement asserting that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will issue a public statement prior to July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, and official communication declaring that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President in the upcoming 2024 election.

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any doubt that Biden would consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election relative to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The determining source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight employs to calculate its data will not influence the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data points for July 20 are released. The resolution of this market may be delayed until the July 20 data points are available. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the close of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still serving as the US President by the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in his position as President until the end of July 2024?

This will be considered a YES if Biden continues to hold the office of US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (The position of Acting President is different from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

This inquiry will conclude as No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

In any other scenario, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions, leading to a resolution of **Yes**.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if the athlete with the highest number of gold medals does not compete in swimming and women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to achieve the highest number of gold medals, or for the same country to secure victories in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The competitor who earns the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports, which include association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The answer will be **No** if the competitor with the highest gold medal count does not take part in swimming and if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs each win gold in the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals or for the same country to triumph in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The competitor who achieves the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming. (b) A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The response will be **No** if the individual with the highest gold medal count does not take part in swimming and if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Can a swimmer achieve the most gold medals or can one nation win in several women's team events at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The athlete who secures the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics is a swimmer. (b) One National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team events: soccer, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The answer will be **No** if the person with the most gold medals does not compete in swimming and if women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team events.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identifiable Democratic House Representatives or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to think about terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of a unified group message. If five individuals independently inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied prior to July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If no such clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden issue a public announcement prior to July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be deemed **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** result, the statement must be unambiguous and definitive: it should remove any chance that Biden would agree to take the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If no such unambiguous announcement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive.

(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden makes a declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue nor accept his party's nomination for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This declaration must be clear, public, official, unambiguous, and final.

(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee. The outcome is determined by the original nomination and will remain unchanged even if the Vice President is substituted for any reason after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President?

(a) Joe Biden makes a public, official, and clear announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive and unambiguous.

(b) Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. The outcome is determined by the initial nomination and will remain unchanged even if the Vice President is altered for any reason after the nomination.

para_P.title: Could it occur that one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination, or (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Vice Presidential candidate for the Democrats?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden issues a public, official, and clear declaration prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election. The statement must be clear and definitive.

(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic candidate for Vice President. This decision is based on the initial nomination and will not change even if the Vice Presidential candidate is replaced for any reason following the nomination.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is given by (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will determine if Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 3 and up to 4 points in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive score of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would correspond to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden surpass 3 but remain at or below 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: By July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden of more than 3 but no more than 4 points according to the national polling average from 538, or will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if either of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 but does not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, as verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024; (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Clarification for (a): Here, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be regarded as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question. 

Clarification for (b): This question is not confined to the candidates presently listed; it is possible for additional candidates to emerge later. The decision about who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it is exclusively based on the choice made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a credible news organization report the incident no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post announces the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not meet the criteria.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a credible news organization report the event at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered TRUE if a major and trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours ahead of President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not be deemed adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden opts to step down, will a reputable news outlet announce this at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be regarded as TRUE if a significant and reliable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden's official declaration of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be considered sufficient.

This market will be labeled as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024 (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) If President Joe Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) A lethal strike by Israel occurs within Iran prior to May 1, 2024 (b) In the event Joe Biden withdraws, a reputable news source reports on it at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following happens:

(a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an attack attributed to Israel that takes place within the borders of Iran and results in the deaths of a minimum of five people.

(b) If President Joe Biden withdraws before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, a major and trustworthy media organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the National Democratic Convention concludes.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following will happen: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024 (b) If Joe Biden withdraws, a trustworthy news outlet reports on it at least 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) After this question is published and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an attack attributed to Israel within Iran has resulted in the deaths of five or more people.

(b) If President Joe Biden withdraws before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, a major and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events occurs: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024 (b) If Joe Biden steps down, a reliable news source informs about it at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Following the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, trustworthy sources report that an assault attributed to Israel in Iran has led to the fatalities of five or more individuals.

(b) If President Joe Biden resigns before the end of the National Democratic Convention, a prominent and credible news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the resignation with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden's official announcement of his resignation through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be designated as N/A if President Joe Biden does not resign before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) a reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of either of these happening: (a) a subsequent Democratic party presidential debate taking place before the 2024 Convention (b) a trustworthy media source reporting on Joe Biden's withdrawal 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is a debate among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.
(b) This question will be marked as YES if a prominent and credible media organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) another Democratic presidential debate takes place prior to the 2024 Convention (b) a credible news source reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It resolves to NO otherwise.
(b) This question resolves to YES if a prominent and trustworthy media organization, such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post, reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Could it occur that one of the following takes place: (a) an additional Democratic presidential debate is held before the 2024 Convention (b) a reputable news outlet announces Joe Biden's withdrawal 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is a debate featuring possible Democratic candidates (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO otherwise.
(b) This inquiry will be marked as YES if a major and reliable news organization, such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post, reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before his formal announcement via a letter, speech, etc. This market will be considered N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the legislative elections in France in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official electoral alliance or coalition agreement is declared between Les Républicains and the National Rally before June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If there is no announcement of such an agreement, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?

Conversely, if no such coalition is declared, the outcome will be **No**.

On the other hand, if no such partnership is announced, the result will be **No**.

question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by the given deadlines, either (a) the French Republicans (Les Républicains) will establish a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative election, or (b) the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if there is an official announcement of a political alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election) before June 30, 2024, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). para_P.body:
(a) This question will receive a **Yes** if there is an official declaration of a political partnership or coalition agreement between the Republicans (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election) prior to June 30, 2024, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not publicly disclosed, the answer will be **No**.

(b) The answer will be **Yes** if the Prime Minister of France's political party is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% advantage among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests their choice of a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants reflect the broader public? 

This market will be resolved with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. 

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a non-specific Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests their choice of a non-specific Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these surveys either leads or is close to the margin of error. Are the responses from Manifold participants indicative of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater upon the closing of both polls.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until their closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump receive at least 3% more backing from Manifold participants when competing against Joe Biden instead of an unspecified Democrat?
para_P.body:
Two surveys from Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One survey prompts Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks for their preference for an unspecified Democrat on the same theoretical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show that Joe Biden is behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while every other Democrat evaluated in these polls either leads or is nearly tied within the margin of error. Do the responses from Manifold participants reflect the opinions of the general population?

This market will result in a YES if the share of votes for Donald Trump in the first survey exceeds that in the second survey by 3% or more at the time both surveys close.

To determine the percentage of votes for Trump, apply the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the results of poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. Otherwise, the outcome will be NO.

The surveys and this question will not conclude as N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time, no matter the situation.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump give testimony in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify in the hush money case?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or through remote means, during the [court proceedings](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, or will he testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(1) Will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more votes among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat? This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6. The first poll includes Joe Biden, and the second includes a generic Democrat. If the percentage of votes for Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second by 3% or more, this part resolves YES. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This resolves YES if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This combined question resolves YES if either (1) or (2) resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will Trump achieve a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents against Biden, or will he take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(1) Is it possible for Donald Trump to secure at least 3% additional votes among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden compared to a standard Democrat? This will be determined by two Manifold polls concluding on July 6. The first poll features Joe Biden, while the second includes a standard Democrat. If Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second by 3% or more, this part will be considered YES. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? This will be considered YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The overall question will be deemed YES if either (1) or (2) is answered YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Trump to increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold respondents against Biden, or will he give testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(1) Is there a chance that Donald Trump will receive at least 3% more votes from Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat? This will be evaluated based on two Manifold polls that close on July 6. The first poll features Joe Biden, while the second one presents a generic Democrat. If the percentage of votes for Trump in the first poll surpasses that of the second by 3% or more, this part will be considered YES. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? This will be marked as YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This overall question will be marked as YES if either (1) or (2) is determined to be YES.

para_P.title: Can Trump boost his support by at least 3% among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden, or will he testify in the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(1) Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will gain at least 3% additional votes from Manifold respondents in a matchup against Joe Biden relative to a generic Democrat? This will be assessed based on two Manifold polls that conclude on July 6. The first poll includes Joe Biden, while the second features a generic Democrat. If Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that of the second by 3% or more, this will be classified as YES. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump give testimony at the hush money trial? This will be marked as YES if credible sources confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This overall question will be considered YES if either (1) or (2) is found to be YES.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other contenders will result in **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is open to the possibility of other candidates being introduced in the future.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** designation if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention to represent the party in the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any selection of other candidates will result in a **No**. The question allows for the introduction of additional candidates in the future.

For the purposes of this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election does not matter; the focus is solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will decline the nomination for President from the Democratic Party?

This will resolve identically to the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

A Yes resolution will occur if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You may contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the specified date, this part will resolve as No.

The resolution of this combined question depends on the resolution of either part (a) or part (b) as described above.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, indicating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either of the subsequent events takes place:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, declaring that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the specified date, this component will resolve as No.

The outcome of this combined question hinges on the resolution of either part (a) or part (b) as outlined above.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden publicly declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Ted Cruz is named the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This determination is based solely on the choices made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on election day in 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would consider accepting the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the specified deadline, this component will conclude as No.

The outcome of this combined inquiry hinges on the resolution of either segment (a) or segment (b) as outlined above.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following events happens:

(a) Ted Cruz is officially designated as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision will rely solely on the selections made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who is declared as the Republican nominee on election day in 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, eliminating any chance that Biden might consider accepting the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the specified deadline, this part will be concluded as No.

The result of this combined question depends on the outcome of either part (a) or part (b) as described above.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other applicable authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator is urging Merrick Garland to employ the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will either the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July or Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and causes the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% in comparison to June 2024, utilizing the specific figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to assert that "the President cannot fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and subsequently allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not applicable.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% in July, or will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% in comparison to June 2024, based on the precise figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to assert that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden's departure from office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Could the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July, or might Biden be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body: This question will be answered positively if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 reflects a rise greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024, as indicated by the exact data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to perform the responsibilities and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not a factor, and Biden's exit from office due to death, resignation, etc., or the activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
