question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Will there be an authorized referendum in Scotland concerning independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if an official referendum takes place in Scotland about its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be of an "advisory" nature; it is not required for the referendum to have any legal binding consequences.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of vote where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the referendum, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. The referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct a formal, approved referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if an official referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to carry any legal authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum in which the UK government has refused to authorize the vote, nor by a referendum organized by civil society organizations. For a referendum to be recognized, it must have the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Could Scotland potentially hold a sanctioned and official referendum regarding its independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a **Yes** if a legitimate referendum about Scotland's separation from the United Kingdom occurs before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be referred to as an "advisory" referendum, indicating it does not require any legal standing.

A referendum will not be deemed valid if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum that the UK government has not authorized, nor will it be valid if it is organized by civil society groups. For a referendum to be acknowledged, it must receive the endorsement of the London government.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump is officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any potential reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of removal or disqualification must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these circumstances are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or disqualified from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump be removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" answer if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) pursuant to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

Confirmation of such removal or disqualification must come from official announcements by state governments, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for a resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly examines whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or disqualified from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, leading to him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the response will be negative.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, or (b) Trump is removed from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The condition will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, or (b) Trump is disqualified from a primary ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be answered with yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If not, the answer will be no.

(b) The answer will be "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for a positive resolution. The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that might take place after this date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not disqualified from any ballot, the answer will be negative.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, or (b) Trump is disqualified from a primary ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered true if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If this does not happen, it will be deemed false.

(b) The outcome will be "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The outcome will be "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may arise after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the outcome will be negative.

para_P.title: Could it occur that either (a) Biden exits the race before July 20, or (b) Trump is barred from a primary ballot in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered true if Biden steps down or is otherwise unable to continue in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If this does not happen, it will be deemed false.

(b) The outcome will be "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, court decisions, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative information, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution. The outcome will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the outcome will be negative.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Joe Biden before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, either Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, and official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement declaring that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear announcement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a public declaration from Joe Biden prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a distinct and formal announcement confirming that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** result, the declaration must be clear and conclusive: it must rule out any chance that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the forthcoming 2024 election.

If such a definitive announcement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

By "accessible," it is meant that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (although it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as it was in Italy in early 2023), or not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution will still be positive if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a credible news source report the story a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. 

Coverage from local news, conspiracy theory websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be considered adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report on it no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours ahead of President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy theory websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden opts to pull out, will a credible news outlet announce it at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
A YES response will be given if a prominent and reliable news outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides a report on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation no less than 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal via a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news sources, conspiracy theory websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not be considered sufficient.

This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden dropping out at least 6 hours in advance (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) A reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. This will resolve as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) A trustworthy news organization reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's exit from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes the official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This will be marked as N/A if Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on election day.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) A trustworthy news source reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's exit from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes an official announcement through a letter, speech, etc. This will be marked as N/A if Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is exclusively made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is nominated on election day.

para_P.title: Could it occur that one of the following takes place: (a) A reliable news outlet announces Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours beforehand (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A reliable news outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post discloses Joe Biden's departure from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his formal announcement via a letter, speech, etc. This will be marked as N/A if Joe Biden does not step down before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is solely made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on election day.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is determined to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election relative to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will settle at a 50-50 outcome.

The resolution will reference FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are accessible. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will NOT be factored into the resolution.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?

In the event that both Biden and Trump are given equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date for this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data points for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market will not resolve until the data for July 20 is available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than th..."The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25850/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for the Deadpool & Wolverine reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

If any other candidate is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed, as additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, the individual who ultimately receives the Republican nomination on election day in 2024 is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion is validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative accounts, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded from a ballot and then later reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not excluded from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump be barred from the primary election ballot in any state across the U.S. for a federal role as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" answer if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred from the primary election ballot in any state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

This barring must be confirmed through official state government announcements, judicial decisions, legal documents, or credible news outlets. Speculative narratives, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for a resolution.

A "No" response will be given if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals occurring after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the mentioned grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will be answered negatively.

The question will be answered with a No if neither of these scenarios is fulfilled.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the reported lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when it is reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported number indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden of more than 2 but less than 3 on July 15, 2024, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the lead reported for Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number represents a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading by 2.4 points, this will be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by their specified deadlines, either (1) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) shows a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:

For this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden in the lead. question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation deal or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the question will be deemed **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: The query will resolve to **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors at Tesla. If not, the query will resolve to **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will ISS advise Tesla investors to reject Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if ISS provides a clear recommendation for Tesla investors to vote *against* Elon Musk's compensation plan at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or to oppose Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board of directors. If such a recommendation is not made, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body: (a) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. (b) The question will resolve YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to happen: (a) the associated market reaches a minimum of 377 participants by the conclusion of July 15, or (b) ISS recommends that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's compensation plan or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: (a) The associated market will confirm YES if it achieves 377 participants prior to the market's closing time on July 15 (11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will confirm NO if this does not occur. (b) This inquiry will confirm YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a declaration clearly advising Tesla investors to reject Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR to oppose Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. If neither of these conditions are met, it will confirm NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) the associated market attracts no fewer than 377 participants by the close of July 15, or (b) ISS recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's continued position on the board?
para_P.body: (a) The associated market will be deemed to have resolved in the affirmative if it gathers 377 participants prior to the market's closure on July 15 at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. It will be considered a negative resolution otherwise. (b) This inquiry will be affirmed if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a clear recommendation for Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting, or against Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. If not, it will be resolved negatively.

para_P.title: Could it be that one of the following occurs: (a) the related market garners at least 377 participants by the end of July 15, or (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to reject Elon Musk's compensation proposal or Kimbal Musk's ongoing role on the board?
para_P.body: (a) The related market will be considered to have resolved positively if it attracts 377 participants before the market closes on July 15 at 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Otherwise, it will be deemed a negative resolution. (b) This question will be confirmed if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) provides a definitive recommendation for Tesla shareholders to oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting, or to oppose Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board. If this does not occur, it will be resolved negatively.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator requests Merrick Garland to enforce the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Could Biden be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the responsibilities and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (b) Joe Biden dies?
question.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen prior to August 2024: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden passes away?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant group) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden passes away: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to August 2024: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden passes away?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: This is considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden passes away: This is considered a YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Could one of the following events occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is deemed incapacitated as per Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden dies?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden being declared incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: This would be a YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant entity) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this inquiry. Biden resigning, dying, etc., does not count as leaving the presidency. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

(b) Joe Biden's death: This would be a YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it will be a NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention anticipated for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention anticipated for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires several voting rounds during its roll call ballot to formally choose its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. On the other hand, if only one ballot is sufficient, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) At any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

If neither of these occurs, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step down prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) The Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) Before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are requesting Biden to withdraw.

If neither scenario occurs, then this question will be marked as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following to take place: (a) the Democrats hold a contested convention in 2024, or (b) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) Before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive must display 10 or more Democratic Senators advocating for Biden to step aside.

If neither of these conditions is satisfied, then the question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Could either of the following occur: (a) the Democrats experience a contested convention in 2024, or (b) at least 10 Senators from the Democratic Party call on Biden to withdraw prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) The Democratic Party requires several rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to formally determine its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) By midnight Central Time on July 20, the New York Times interactive must show 10 or more Democratic Senators supporting the idea of Biden stepping down.

If neither of these scenarios takes place, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will conclude with a Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both categories. It will conclude with a No if either the men's or women's team does not finish in first place.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be considered a Yes if Team USA claims both gold medals. It will be a No if either the men's or women's team finishes in any position other than first.

para_P.title: Can the United States achieve gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be deemed a Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. It will be considered a No if either the men's or women's team does not finish in first place.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the Top 5 in the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are counted as affirmative) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the overall medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In cases of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In cases of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be between 2 and 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number represents an advantage for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive number of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently discussed; additional possibilities may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Republican National Convention chooses Donald Trump Jr. as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to candidates not yet mentioned, as additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
