This question will be answered with a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. If any other candidates are chosen, the answer will be **No**. This inquiry allows for candidates not yet discussed, as new contenders may arise in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who ultimately holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it solely depends on who is designated by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to cast their votes with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other presents a generic Democrat for voting.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the error margin. Are the opinions of Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will be resolved as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote including Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet every other Democrat surveyed in similar hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will confirm a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump achieve a minimum of a 3% lead among Manifold participants when facing Joe Biden instead of a conventional Democrat?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to include Joe Biden in their voting on a hypothetical ballot, while the other involves a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys have consistently shown Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while every other Democrat evaluated in similar scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants reflect the general public's views?

This market will confirm a YES if Donald Trump's percentage of votes in the first poll exceeds that of the second poll by 3% or more at the close of both polls.

To determine Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES will be given if the outcome of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time, regardless of any circumstances.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) In the Manifold polls, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the result of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is greater than or equal to 0.03, this part of the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump Jr. will be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Trump achieve at least a 3% higher support among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat against Joe Biden?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following situations occurs: (a) The Republican National Convention selects Donald Trump Jr. as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by the nominee chosen on election day. (b) According to the Manifold polls, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the result of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is at least 0.03, then this part of the question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump Jr. will be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or could Trump achieve a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold respondents against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This nomination is determined exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is nominated on election day. (b) In the Manifold surveys, the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden is at least 3% higher than in the poll against a generic Democrat when both polls conclude on July 6. The vote percentage for Trump is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the difference between the Biden poll result and the generic Democrat poll result is 0.03 or more, then this part of the question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump Jr. be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or might he secure at least 3% additional backing from Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden versus a generic Democrat?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** response if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is officially nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This nomination is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is chosen on election day. (b) In the Manifold surveys, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the matchup against Joe Biden is at least 3% greater than in the matchup against a generic Democrat when both surveys close on July 6. The vote percentage for Trump is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the difference between the Biden poll result and the generic Democrat poll result is 0.03 or more, then this aspect of the question will conclude with a **Yes**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump have a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but does not surpass 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the extent to which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates a Biden advantage. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party anticipated?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is it anticipated that there will be an additional presidential debate for the Democratic party?
para_P.body: Establishes YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic contenders (including Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Establishes NO in all other scenarios.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

This combined question resolves as YES if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as described, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he won't accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or that there will be another Democratic presidential debate?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, official announcement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive.

(b) Will there be an additional Democratic presidential debate? This is considered YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It is NO otherwise.

This overall question is answered with YES if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as outlined, or (b) there is another Democratic presidential debate as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he won't be accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or will there be an additional Democratic party presidential debate?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

(b) Will there be another debate among Democratic party presidential candidates? This will be a Yes if a debate occurs involving potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No otherwise.

This combined inquiry will be answered with a Yes if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as outlined, or (b) there is an additional debate among Democratic party candidates as described.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden announce that he will not seek the Democratic nomination prior to July 15, 2024, or will there be another debate for Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be marked as a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official announcement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive.

(b) Will there be an additional debate among candidates for the Democratic party's presidential nomination? This will be a Yes if a debate takes place involving potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No in all other cases.

This combined question will receive a Yes answer if either (a) Joe Biden makes the specified announcement, or (b) there is another debate among Democratic party candidates as described.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. The possibility of new candidates emerging in the future is also taken into account.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention to represent the party in the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any alternative candidates will result in a **No**. This inquiry may also consider new candidates that could arise in the future.

For the purposes of this question, the identity of the nominee chosen by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the conclusion is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the day of the election.

para_P.title: On July 20, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be greater than it was a year prior, or will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if one of the following takes place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024, surpasses its value from July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) The Republican National Convention designates Donald Trump as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of other candidates or the ultimate nominee on election day.

para_P.title: On July 20, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be greater than it was a year prior, or will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is recorded on July 20, 2024, at a level that exceeds its value from July 20, 2023, as reported by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) The Republican National Convention officially nominates Donald Trump for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, regardless of other candidates or the final nominee on election day.

para_P.title: On July 20, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index exceed its value from a year earlier, or will Donald Trump obtain the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: A YES answer will be given if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is noted on July 20, 2024, at a figure that surpasses its level from July 20, 2023, as documented by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) The Republican National Convention formally designates Donald Trump as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This conclusion relies solely on the decision made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of other candidates or the final nominee on election day.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered as **YES** if they make a *public* report available by June 30, 2024, which includes the findings from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing the findings from an external evaluation of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be considered **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, containing the results from an *external* entity that has conducted red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report outlining the results from an independent assessment of their safety models prior to June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be marked as **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, which includes findings from an *external* organization that has performed red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to everyone in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

The term "accessible to everyone" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is the ability to use it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can access it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other scenarios.

"Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without the need for a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (and not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be resolved positively if there is a change in name or website, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a **YES** response if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU by June 30, 2024, and a **NO** in all other circumstances.

"Generally available" means that the typical scenario for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (although it may involve a fee). In this context, "ChatGPT" specifically refers to the general web interface (not the API) used for interacting with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if there is a change in branding or website, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (enabling users to submit inquiries to systems driven by Large Language Models).

question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will happen: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing findings from an external safety evaluation of their models, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this will be marked as **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showing the outcomes from an *independent* evaluation of one of their AI models' safety.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be marked as **YES** if it is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in some EU nations, or not accessible to certain demographics (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general online interface for engaging with GPT models and will be considered positively even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) a report detailing the outcomes of external safety evaluations of Google DeepMind's models is published, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) In the case of Google DeepMind, this will be considered **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the answer will be **YES** if it is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations, or not accessible to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered positive if more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web platform for engaging with GPT models, and will be positively resolved even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains largely unchanged.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, is it possible that one of the following occurs: (a) a publication emerges that outlines the results of external safety assessments of Google DeepMind's models, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes extensively available within the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) Regarding Google DeepMind, this will be marked as **YES** if they issue a *public* document by June 30, 2024, which contains the results of an *external* review of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, the answer will be **YES** if it is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the typical scenario for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not obtainable in certain EU countries, or not available to particular demographics (such as minors), it will still be considered affirmative if over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the overall web interface for interacting with GPT models and will be positively adjudicated even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. Additional candidates may be included in the future beyond those currently listed.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not go beyond 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead that Donald Trump has over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: By July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 but not surpass 4, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the margin by which Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart dated July 15, 2024, when analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a Trump lead, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 3 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and does not depend on who is announced as the nominee on election day. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4, according to the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure reflects a lead for Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Ted Cruz becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is independent of who is nominated on election day. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 and at most 4, as shown on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Could Ted Cruz potentially be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or might Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 but not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** response if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The Republican National Convention selects Ted Cruz as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is solely made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who is nominated on election day. (b) On July 15, 2024, the national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden exceeds 3 but does not go beyond 4, as reflected in the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates Trump is ahead.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains Within the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if the location is not classified under any categories that suggest Russian control, which includes, but is not limited to:

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This question will be answered with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being removed or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the resolution will be negative.

This question will be answered with a "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

The exclusion or disqualification must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial decisions, legal documents, or credible media outlets. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not be sufficient for a resolution.

A "No" response will be given if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly examines whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution.

   The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)

* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the dates of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the answer will be No if this scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental body of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered in the affirmative if a terrorist incident occurs in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) that results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, aside from the terrorist(s), within the timeframe starting from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the answer will be negative if such an event does not take place.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French state agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

On the other hand, the response will be negative if such an incident does not occur.

An event will be deemed a 'terrorist act' if it is categorized as such by any French governmental body, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or through a remote connection, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the trial concerning hush money?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via a remote connection, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the suspected "hush money" dealings with Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump outpaces Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the graph for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump surpasses Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as represented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates a lead for Biden. For example, on July 5, 2024, the indicated value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a 45-minute or longer live interview before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest relevant interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he engaged in a discussion for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve as YES, Biden must take part in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no such interview is available by the market's closing at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are part of programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50-minute video could potentially only contain 20 minutes of Biden in an interview, which would not be sufficient. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place in April when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden participates in another in-person interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are part of a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his stint on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes all featured less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a direct, on-camera conversation or interview exceeding 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview occurred in April during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show, where he engaged with questions for around 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. On the other hand, if no qualifying interview is released before the market closes at the end of July, it will result in a NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may encompass guest spots on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews featured in a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage with Biden being interviewed in-person for these appearances to count. A 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his earlier segments on 60 Minutes all included less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed.

Should Biden engage in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be valid. A 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not qualifying. For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is determined to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve as a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a "No" if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. Should Biden and Trump possess equal probabilities, this market will resolve in a 50-50 outcome.

The resolution will depend on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Alterations in the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will be settled based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may not reach a resolution until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is determined to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, as per the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will yield a "No" if Donald Trump is deemed to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. If Biden and Trump are assessed to have equal chances, this market will resolve in a tie.

The outcome will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election predictions, which can be found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically looking at the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology for calculating its data will not influence the resolution of this market.

This market will be settled based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is published. It is possible that this market may not reach a conclusion until the data for July 20 is available. Please note that the resolution refers to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be considered.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

For part (b), the resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its data will not affect the outcome of this market. The count of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if either of the following takes place: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

Regarding part (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; what counts is who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution in this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. The resolution will refer to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in support for Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's advantage, while a negative figure suggests Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.
