para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported statistic shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered by analyzing Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the data for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number suggests Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which is interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and it will result in a **No** for any other scenarios. In cases where two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their dissent against their party’s intention to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they claim suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and force unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the expedited nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, then this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic lawmakers from either the House or the Senate publicly oppose the initiative to fast-track Biden’s nomination?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Several Democrats in the House are collaborating on a plan to express their opposition to their party’s efforts to hasten President Joe Biden’s nomination, arguing that this undermines the essential ongoing dialogue regarding his candidacy, as stated by a legislator involved in this effort.

A letter that has been prepared, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public sign from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain quite uneasy about Biden’s candidacy progressing.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to suppress discussion and enforce unity, but that strategy is ineffective,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter is real.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement against the accelerated nomination plan is endorsed by a minimum of 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are several letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these requirements are not met by the market close, then this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the upcoming 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democrats have to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires several voting rounds in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the forthcoming 2024 US presidential election. On the other hand, if only one ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these criteria are met, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly express their opposition to the early nomination strategy, or will there be a contested convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, a public statement against the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators. It is also acceptable if several letters together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither condition is satisfied, the answer will be NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the early nomination strategy, or will there be a contested convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if one of the following happens: (a) A public statement against the early nomination strategy is endorsed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House members or Senators prior to the market's closure at the end of Sunday, July 21st. It would also suffice if multiple statements collectively have a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements. (b) The Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither condition is satisfied, this inquiry will be deemed NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from either the House or Senate publicly oppose the early nomination strategy, or will the Democrats face a contested convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) A public opposition to the early nomination strategy receives endorsements from at least 20 Democratic representatives or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Alternatively, it would be sufficient if multiple statements together garner endorsements from a total of 20 lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially choose its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the answer will be NO.

para_P.title: Will the Democrats have to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will yield **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires several voting rounds in the roll call ballot to formally select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. On the other hand, if just one ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur for the 2024 US Presidential Election: (a) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee, or (b) Democrats have a brokered convention?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this part resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that for the 2024 US Presidential Election, either (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee, or (b) the Democrats face a brokered convention?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) The Republican National Convention chooses Francis Suarez as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the delegates' selection. (b) The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in their roll call ballot to officially nominate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this part will be answered with **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that, for the 2024 US Presidential Election, either (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee, or (b) the Democrats face a brokered convention?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) The Republican National Convention chooses Francis Suarez as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the decisions made by the delegates at the convention. (b) The Democratic Party needs to conduct multiple rounds of voting in their roll call ballot to officially nominate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this part will be answered as **No**.

para_P.title: Could it happen that, in the 2024 US Presidential Election, either (a) Francis Suarez secures the Republican nomination, or (b) the Democrats encounter a contested convention?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The Republican National Convention selects Francis Suarez as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, determined solely by the delegates' choices at the convention. (b) The Democratic Party is required to hold several rounds of voting in their roll call ballot to officially designate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this aspect will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a political coalition formed between Les Républicains and the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative elections?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if an official announcement regarding an electoral collaboration or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not made, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official electoral coalition or alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally is declared before June 30, 2024, based on information from [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If there is no announcement of such an agreement, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Are Les Républicains expected to join forces with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if there is a formal announcement of an electoral coalition or partnership between Les Républicains and the National Rally prior to June 30, 2024, according to details from [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such declaration is made, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Prime Minister of France part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that the Prime Minister of France will be part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable information.

para_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France be a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a yes answer if, on July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France's political party is Together, according to trustworthy sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 30, 2024: (a) The Republican Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this component resolves as **No**. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: By July 30, 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The French Republican Party collaborates politically with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France (b) The Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) An official announcement of an electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republican Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made before June 30, 2024, based on reliable sources. If such an agreement is not announced, this part will conclude as **No**. (b) As of July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together, as reported by credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, this question will be resolved as **Yes**. If neither is satisfied, it will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 30, 2024, one of the following will take place: (a) The French Republican Party establishes a coalition with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France (b) The Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is satisfied: (a) An official announcement of a coalition or electoral alliance between the Republican Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative elections is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by reliable sources. If such an announcement does not occur, this part will be deemed **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France is a member of the Together coalition, based on credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is fulfilled, this question will be resolved as **Yes**. If neither condition is met, it will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Could it be that by July 30, 2024, one of the following events occurs: (a) The French Republican Party forms a coalition with the National Rally for the upcoming 2024 legislative elections in France (b) The Prime Minister of France is part of the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following criteria is met: (a) An official declaration of a coalition or electoral partnership between the Republican Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative elections is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by trustworthy sources. If such a declaration does not take place, this part will be marked **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition, according to reliable sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, this question will be answered as **Yes**. If neither condition is fulfilled, it will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 3 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the graph for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden exceed 3 but remain at or below 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the extent to which Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects Trump's advantage, while a negative number indicates Biden's advantage. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 in relation to this inquiry.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this matter, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Larry Elder be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Larry Elder is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates presently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Larry Elder be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will receive a **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; further options may be added later.

For this question, it does not matter who wins the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Will either of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538, or (b) will Larry Elder be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive result indicates a Trump lead, while a negative result signifies Biden is ahead.
(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than by who is nominated on election day.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following scenarios to take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 and is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 3 and at most 4 points in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive score indicates a Trump lead, while a negative score indicates Biden is in the lead.
(b) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome is based on the decision made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than the individual who is nominated on election day.

para_P.title: Could one of the following situations occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Larry Elder is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 3 and at most 4 points in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, as verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive result indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative result signifies Biden is ahead.
(b) This question will be marked **Yes** if Larry Elder is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The result is determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by the individual who is announced on election day.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A Republican legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacitation is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Section 4 of the 25th Amendment be activated to deem Biden unable to serve before August?
para_P.body:
This is considered a YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable entity), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacitation does not pertain to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not relevant. Additionally, Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not taken into account.

Context: A Republican lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will announce by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be unequivocal and final: it should remove any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 or (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. 

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, or (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered a **Yes** if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position. 

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should not allow for any interpretation that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden is officially declared unable to fulfill his duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, or (b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered **Yes** if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to enact the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. 

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following scenarios could occur: (a) Biden is officially deemed unable to perform his duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, or (b) Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as **Yes** if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not relevant for this inquiry. Biden's exit from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. 

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official declaration indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it must rule out any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is a Woman Going to be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered resolved as “yes” when a female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

It will be deemed resolved as “no” when the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

This will be marked as “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim hampers the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman expressed in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of any letter.

This market will determine a YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain significantly uneasy about the direction of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He opted not to confirm the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even several letters totaling 20 signatures from lawmakers would be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not met by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also suffice. If neither condition is met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president by the conclusion of July 2024, or will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members publicly endorse a letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of time?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still the recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is endorsed by no fewer than 20 members of the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party. It is also acceptable if multiple letters together contain a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. If neither of these scenarios happens, the answer will be NO.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in the presidency, or will at least 20 Democratic Representatives or Senators have publicly opposed the plan to nominate Biden early by signing a letter?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is endorsed by no fewer than 20 members of the House or Senate who are aligned with the Democratic Party. It is also acceptable if there are multiple letters that together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. If neither of these scenarios happens, the answer to this question will be negative.

para_P.title: As of the end of July 2024, will Joe Biden still be in the role of president, or will a minimum of 20 Democratic lawmakers have expressed their dissent against the proposal to nominate Biden early by signing a letter?
para_P.body: This question will be deemed affirmative if at least one of the following situations takes place: (a) Joe Biden continues to hold the position of the president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) By the conclusion of Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 Democratic Representatives or Senators. It is also acceptable if there are several letters that collectively have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. If neither of these conditions is met, the response to this question will be negative.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic Party will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, then this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the response will be **No**.

para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires several voting rounds during its roll call ballot to formally choose its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. On the other hand, if only one ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this will be marked as **No**.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early: This will be marked as **Yes** if at least 20 members of the House or Senate who are part of the Democratic caucus sign a public letter against the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, multiple letters that together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, it will be marked as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this will be considered **No**.

(b) A minimum of 20 House or Senate Democrats will publicly sign a letter against the plan to nominate Biden early: This will be considered **Yes** if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following scenarios will occur: (a) Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will openly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024: This will be deemed **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to formally select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this will be classified as **No**.

(b) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats will publicly endorse a letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early: This will be marked as **Yes** if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by a minimum of 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Furthermore, multiple letters totaling 20 signatures from lawmakers would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this will resolve to NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically assessed performs either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the views of Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never result in N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump appear as a witness in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify in the hush money case?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or remotely, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the purported "hush money" payments involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran engage in military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

For this market, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action taken by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is publicly recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered in the resolution of this market.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian land will be taken into account for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Iran's military action prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will conclude with a "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility located in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground incursions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered in the resolution of this market.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian land, will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Assaults on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Iran's military operations before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will yield a "Yes" result if Iran executes a military action on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime regions between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If such an action does not take place, the market will result in a "No".

For this market's purposes, a "military action" is defined as any use of force by Iran against Israeli land, airspace, or maritime territories (for instance, if an Iranian missile targets a military installation in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or substantiated by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not factor into the resolution of this market.

Only military actions carried out by Iranian forces that are formally recognized by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. 

For the purposes of this component, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this component will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this component.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this component. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this component.
