para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if either of the following situations arises: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) announce that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in-person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zone between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. 

For this aspect, a "military operation" is defined as any forceful action taken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zone (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot located in Israel, this aspect will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not contribute to the resolution of this aspect.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian land, will be counted for the resolution of this aspect. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy forces (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this aspect.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will give testimony at the hush money trial or that Iran will launch a military operation against Israel before August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. 

For this aspect, a "military operation" is defined as any act of force conducted by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot on Israeli territory, this aspect will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial assaults, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered in the resolution of this aspect.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil will be counted for this aspect. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this aspect.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump potentially testify at the hush money trial or might Iran initiate a military action against Israel prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following occurs: (a) [Trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. For this criterion, a "military operation" is defined as any use of force undertaken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile hits a weapons storage facility in Israel, this will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible reports. Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have been launched from Iranian territory will be counted for this criterion. Attacks on Israel by proxy organizations (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this criterion.

question.body:

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. In the event that both candidates are viewed as equally likely to win, this market will resolve at a rate of 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. It may not resolve until the figures for July 20 are released. Should there be no available data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the chances of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 figures are available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the odds of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will NOT be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will 538 show Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is forecasted to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will yield a “No” if Donald Trump is indicated to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. If both candidates are assigned equal chances, the market will result in a 50-50 outcome.

The resolution will depend on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, which can be found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically looking at the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not impact the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. It may stay unresolved until the data for July 20 is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the nearest available figures preceding July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for instance, “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would represent a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by examining the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) presented in the chart for July 15, 2024, which will be analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure of 2.4 points shows Trump leading Biden, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will either 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will 538 either show Biden as the frontrunner, or will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (1) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. This will be assessed using the blue and red trend lines displayed on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ once data points for July 20 are accessible. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding numbers to July 19 will be utilized. (2) On July 15, 2024, the difference in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election shows that Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 4 points, as indicated on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will FiveThirtyEight either show Biden as the frontrunner, or will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if one of the following scenarios occurs: (1) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential race compared to Donald Trump. This will be assessed using the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ once data points for July 20 are released. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior figures to July 19 will be utilized. (2) Donald Trump's edge over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported to be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will FiveThirtyEight either indicate that Biden is leading, or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: This question will result in a "Yes" if one of the following conditions is satisfied: (1) Based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is anticipated to have a greater probability of winning the US presidential election in comparison to Donald Trump. This will be evaluated using the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ once the data points for July 20 are released. If the data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest preceding data to July 19 will be considered. (2) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is noted to be more than 2 and at most 4 points as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive value signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative value indicates a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: Could Francis Suarez potentially be the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election, or might a coalition of 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the nominee chosen on election day. (b) If, before midnight Central Time on July 20, a group of 10 or more Democratic Senators urges Biden to resign, according to the source of the resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If neither of these events occurs, the conclusion will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent entity) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and duties of his office" and designates the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican lawmaker is urging Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 consider Biden the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates possess equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will refer to FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically relying on the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 becomes accessible. The resolution may be delayed until the July 20 data is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of securing victory in the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump are evaluated to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at a 50-50 split.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest preceding data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the probabilities of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is determined to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is considered to have a better opportunity of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump are assessed to have equal chances, the market will resolve at a 50-50 split.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is published. It is possible that this market may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. It is crucial to note that the resolution pertains to the probabilities of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The total number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August or 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This resolves to YES if Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, or that the 538 projections will show Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if one of the following takes place:

(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent entity) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Any departure from the presidency by Biden through death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024. This will be answered affirmatively if FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election on July 19, 2024, indicates Joe Biden as the leading candidate over Donald Trump. If both candidates have equal chances, the resolution will be 50-50. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will be based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August, or that the 538 projection shows Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if any of the following situations occur:

(a) Biden is acknowledged as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This is determined if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc. does not qualify. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

(b) Joe Biden is forecasted to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election projection for July 19, 2024. This will be deemed affirmative if Joe Biden is indicated as the favorite over Donald Trump in FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election projection for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this will resolve as 50-50. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election projection, particularly the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no data points for July 19 are present by July 22, this will resolve based on the closest earlier figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Biden may be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August, or that the 538 forecast indicates Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if any of the following conditions are met:

(a) Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024. This determination occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this inquiry. Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Additionally, Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This will be considered affirmative if Joe Biden is shown as the preferred candidate over Donald Trump in FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election projection for that date. If both candidates are indicated to have equal chances, this will be treated as a 50-50 outcome. The resolution will depend on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election projection, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will be based on the nearest earlier figures to July 19.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the ID party secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will conclude as **No** for any other political parties. In the event that two parties are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

It will be answered with **No** for all other political parties. In cases where two parties are tied in seat count, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

In situations where two parties have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked with **Yes**.

The answer to this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media outlets.

question.title: Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This inquiry will be regarded as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documentation, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for a definitive answer.

The question will receive a "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the outlined criteria by July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and later reinstated, leading to him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests participants to choose a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in a hypothetical scenario is either leading or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will remain available until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on the same ballot.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in hypothetical scenarios polls either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the broader public opinion?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude. 

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the vote percentage for poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump achieve a minimum of a 3% rise among Manifold participants if he competes against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
There are two polls conducted by Manifold, both set to close on July 6. One poll asks participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests them to select a generic Democrat.

Surveys of public opinion often show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas other Democrats considered in hypothetical matchups either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the opinions of Manifold participants align with the general public sentiment?

This market will yield a YES if Donald Trump's percentage of votes in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the conclusion of both polls.

Trump's vote percentage is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES is assigned if the difference in vote percentage between poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater; otherwise, the response will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will remain open until the designated closing time, regardless of the situation.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly requested Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they no longer believe Biden can win in November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of them would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. Merely five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Any reports of an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step down will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

This market will be resolved as YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

If these criteria are not met by July 20th, this market will conclude as NO.

Reports of any unnamed Democrats approaching Biden to suggest he withdraw will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market closes. If these conditions are not met by July 20th, the market will resolve negatively.

question.body:

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number represents a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will either "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, or "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th). The score will be taken from the "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page, using the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal). For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes, but the market resolves solely based on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office opening will be reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens:

(a) "Twisters" (2024) receives a Rotten Tomatoes critics rating of at least 75% one week post-release (July 26th). The rating will be sourced from the "Twisters" (2024) page on Rotten Tomatoes, using the exact percentage provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually a whole number, no decimals). For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) currently holds a Tomatometer of 63%. The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for context, but the resolution will depend solely on the score displayed. "Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the 1996 film, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening of **Deadpool & Wolverine** exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office figures will be provided by Boxofficemojo on the respective movie's page.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the recorded value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will the difference in support for Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden be more than 2 but less than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the disparity between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the data for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive outcome reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative outcome indicates Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is posed and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. (b) This question will be answered **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and prior to May 1, 2024, trustworthy reports confirm that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

para_P.title: Will any of the subsequent events take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's margin over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to 538's national polling average? (b) Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this inquiry and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports of an attack attributed to Israel that has taken place within Iran and resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

para_P.title: Will any of the following occurrences happen: (a) On July 15, 2024, will the difference in votes between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but less than 3 based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will Israel carry out a deadly attack inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be determined by the difference in votes between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, as verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is ahead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if, after this inquiry is published and before May 1, 2024, there are trustworthy reports of an attack carried out by Israel within Iran that has resulted in the deaths of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 if the reported number for that date is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be considered to have carried out a deadly attack within Iran if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following events will take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be deemed to have increased Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 if the value reported on that date exceeds the value reported on July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed available at: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be regarded as having conducted a lethal strike within Iran if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources confirm that an attack attributed to Israel occurring within the borders of Iran has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Will Israel execute a lethal strike within Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be regarded as having increased Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 if the value reported on that date exceeds the value reported on July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be deemed to have conducted a lethal strike within Iran if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible reports confirm that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's territory, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

para_P.title: Could either of the following events occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index will reflect a Year-over-Year rise on July 20, 2024? (b) Will Israel carry out a fatal attack inside Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered to have risen Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, if the figure reported on that date surpasses the figure reported on July 20, 2023, based on data from the St. Louis Fed found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be recognized as having executed a fatal strike within Iran if, following the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports indicate that an attack linked to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the deaths of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden fall between 2 and 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling figures between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Will the lead that Trump has over Biden on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but no more than 4, according to 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered by examining the polling data between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as presented by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, and analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure suggests Biden is leading. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which is interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no.
