question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will resolve as YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this will resolve as NO. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will conclude as YES if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the data accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will conclude as YES if Kamala Harris is appointed as the Democratic Vice President. If another individual is chosen as Vice President, this will conclude as NO. The resolution hinges on the original nomination and will remain unchanged if the Vice President is altered for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of the following to happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart available to Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Kamala Harris receives the nomination for Democratic Vice President. If a different candidate is selected as VP, this will be marked as NO. The resolution is determined at the time of the initial nomination and will not be altered if the VP is changed for any reason after that point. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

para_P.title: Could either of the following scenarios occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be recorded as YES if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the chart accessible to Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Kamala Harris is nominated for the position of Democratic Vice President. If another individual is chosen as VP, this will be recorded as NO. The resolution will be determined at the time of the initial nomination and will remain unchanged even if the VP is replaced for any reason thereafter. The market can resolve immediately following the nomination.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will be resolved as YES if Biden engages in another such in-person interview that lasts a minimum of 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in person for these appearances to be valid. For instance, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another in-person interview for no less than 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will conclude with a NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews incorporated into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify. For instance, a 50-minute video may only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview or discussion on camera that exceeds 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview took place when Biden appeared on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for around 70 minutes. 

If Biden takes part in another face-to-face interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. On the other hand, if no qualifying interview is released to the public before the market closes at the end of July, this market will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may encompass guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews included in programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person for such appearances to qualify. For example, a 50-minute video may only display 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not meet the criteria. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each featured less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not go beyond 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) based on the data for July 15, 2024, which will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number indicates Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the value showed Trump leading by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden will participate in an in-person interview or discussion on camera for more than 45 minutes before July 2024 ends. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs such as 60 Minutes, but does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. A minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person is necessary for it to qualify.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 based on 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election in 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. This will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Could any of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden takes part in a face-to-face interview or discussion recorded on camera for over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, OR (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden will participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion recorded on camera for a period longer than 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs such as 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. A minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person is required for it to be considered valid.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden. This will be confirmed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden be in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden maintain his position as President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden remains the President of the United States at the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The position of Acting President is separate from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. The determination is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion surrounding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain significantly concerned about the prospects of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart approach to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

Should these conditions not be fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are organizing a plan to overtly challenge their party’s effort to hasten President Joe Biden’s nomination, arguing that it undermines the vital ongoing dialogues concerning his candidacy, as indicated by a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A draft letter, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public sign from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks are quite worried about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He opted not to confirm the letter's existence.

This market will indicate YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative is signed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are several letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would suffice for this market to conclude with a YES. 

If these criteria are not met by the market's closing, it will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 15 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will be determined as "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is not available. question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.
